intro: Dirichletia obovata var. albescens, commonly known as the white-veined dirichletia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, obovate leaves with distinctive white veins. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories.
